title: ARM enjoys a royalty wave despite smartphone drop-off
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now ARM enjoys a royalty wave despite smartphone drop-off Simon Segars, chief executive of ARM, has been with the company since 2013 Susannah Ireland/The Times Nic Fildes Technology & Communications Editor Published at 12:01AM, October 22 2015 
Britain’s largest technology company has defied a slowdown in smartphone sales to report a hefty rise in royalties, which pushed its shares to the top of the FTSE 100 risers’ list yesterday. 
ARM Holdings’ royalties — paid when a product using a chip based on one of its designs is shipped —increased by 37 per cent in the third quarter, while the volume of chips sold jumped by 20 per cent to 3.6 billion. 
Simon Segars, chief executive of the Cambridge-based company, said that the results had come despite the fact that the smartphone sector grew by only 12 per cent Subscribe now
